summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview summary of Juan Alessi, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, conducted on February 19, 2020. Alessi describes his role as a driver and house manager, details about picking up young girls, the presence of Ghislaine Maxwell, and the change in Epstein's behavior after Maxwell's arrival. He also lists numerous high-profile visitors to Epstein's home.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.role: Former employee/driver/house manager for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary interviewee. He was employed by Jeffrey Epstein and describes his duties, including picking up young girls from school and home, and observing the household dynamics.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject's former employer. Alessi describes his behavior, travel habits, interactions with young girls, and the change in his demeanor after Ghislaine Maxwell arrived.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as arriving after Eva Andersson and changing the household dynamics. Alessi states most orders came from her and that younger girls came into the picture when she arrived.

persons.name: Eva Andersson
persons.context: Described as being pleasant and present before Ghislaine Maxwell. Alessi states she was there for about five months and that Epstein was pleasant before Maxwell arrived.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as a guest who arrived at the airport and was driven by Alessi. Also listed among the many different people seen at Epstein's home.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Listed among the many different people, including senators, seen at Epstein's home.

persons.name: Robert Kennedy
persons.context: Listed among the many different people seen at Epstein's home. Likely refers to Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

persons.name: Ruby
persons.context: A British individual whose last name Alessi could not remember. Described as being around all the time and friends with Maxwell and Epstein.

connections.description: Alessi was employed by Epstein as a driver and house manager. He describes following orders from Epstein and Maxwell, and eventually leaving the employment because 'they wanted him to leave.'
Alessi received most of his orders from Maxwell after she arrived. He states her arrival changed everything and that 'younger girls came into the picture.'
Maxwell is described as being with Epstein, giving orders to staff, and traveling with him. Alessi states they were always together with others, never alone.
Andersson was present before Maxwell. Alessi thought Epstein and Andersson remained friends and that she still visited him after marrying.
Alessi thought they had a friendship but were not close, and that they may have hated each other.
Prince Andrew is listed as a guest who visited Epstein's home and was driven by Alessi from the airport.
Ruby is described as a friend of Maxwell and Epstein who was around all the time.

events.title: FBI Interview of Juan Alessi
events.description: The FBI conducted an in-person interview with former Epstein employee Juan Alessi regarding his knowledge of Epstein's activities, staff, and visitors.

events.title: Alessi's Employment with Epstein Ends
events.description: Alessi left Epstein's employment because 'they wanted him to leave.' He hated that he was not allowed to look Epstein in the eyes at the end.

events.title: Arrival of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Alessi describes a significant change in the household when Ghislaine Maxwell arrived, stating 'everything went to hell' and that younger girls came into the picture.

events.title: Frequent Movie Outings
events.description: Epstein, Maxwell, and others, including young girls, went to high-class movie theaters in Boca Raton and West Palm Beach almost every night when Epstein was in town.

keyFacts: Juan Alessi, a former Epstein employee, stated that when Ghislaine Maxwell arrived, 'everything went to hell' and 'younger girls came into the picture.'
Alessi described picking up young girls, including one from school, and driving them to Epstein's home at the direction of Epstein and Maxwell.
Alessi recalled seeing a 'black costume' in Maxwell's closet along with 'all kinds of toys in a basket.'
Alessi listed numerous high-profile visitors to Epstein's home, including Prince Andrew, Donald Trump, Robert Kennedy, and senators.
Alessi stated that Epstein told him he was 'helping' one of the young girls, and that the girl's mother told Epstein, 'Whatever you want to do with [her], she can come anytime.'
